result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andre Jarrod Lowe

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence

Defendant Andre Jarrod Lowe not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Andre Jarrod Lowe.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense further informs court that they intend to file a motion on today's date. Court calendars the next court date for a motion hearing date, and sets the following deadlines: 11/02/2022 deadline for defense to file any motions; 02/10/2022 deadline for the State's response. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Motion hearing scheduled for February 17, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

10:38 AM Defendant Andre Jarrod Lowe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs appeared by video for Andre Jarrod Lowe.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer M. Lazaris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Andre Jarrod Lowe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Erica N Young appeared by video for Andre Jarrod Lowe.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Andre Jarrod Lowe not in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/15/22 @ 1:30p
